newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysian rubber ends unchanged ahead of holiday.
newsitem.headline: Malaysian rubber ends unchanged ahead of holiday.

text.p: The Malaysian rubber market closed at half-day ahead of the New Year holiday, with prices ending unchanged, dealers said.
"There was practically no trading this morning. Most dealers have already closed their books for the year," said one local dealer. The market is closed on Wednesday.

At the close, January RSS1 buyer and SMR 20 buyer were quoted at 316 cents ($1.25) and 310 cents ($1.23) a kg respectively by the Malaysian Rubber Exchange and Licensing Board, both unchanged from Monday's close.
Dealers said they expected prices to remain steady due to a tight supply of raw materials following seasonal rains which have reduced tapping activities at plantations.
They also expect a return of consumer interest after the holiday.
The INRO five-day moving average was 241.57 Malaysian/Singapore cents per kg on Dec 30 against 241.53 on Dec 27. The daily indicator price was 241.80 versus 241.52.
